page.title: 14Earthworks at Granhams Farm
page.content: Great Shelford lies five kilometres south of the city of Cambridge. The position of the earthworks is north of the Cam on Granta. When the last Doomsday book was compiled, the village was very small. The enclosure of the earthworks forms a rectangular shape. There is also a moat which surrounds the house. On three of the sides, there is a moat which also surrounds a house. The east side of the earthworks (the only surviving side) is about one metre high in places. In front of this is a narrow ditch, part of the adjacents field drainage system. Half of the enclosed land is covered by an orchard.
